Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 25:32: And those who disbelieve say: Why is the Qur’an not revealed unto him all at once ? (It is revealed) thus that We may strengthen thy heart therewith; and We have arranged it in right order.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 25:33: And they bring thee no similitude but We bring thee the Truth (as against it), and better (than their similitude) as argument.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 25:34: Those who will be gathered on their faces unto hell: such are worse in plight and further from the right road.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 25:35: We verily gave Moses the Scripture and placed with him his brother Aaron as henchman.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 25:36: Then We said: Go together unto the folk who have denied Our revelations.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 25:37: And Noah’s folk, when they denied the messengers, We drowned them and made of them a portent for mankind.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 25:38: And (the tribes of) A’ad and Thamud, and the dwellers in Ar-Rass, and many generations in between.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 25:39: Each (of them) We warned by examples, and each (of them) We brought to utter ruin.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 25:40: And indeed they have passed by the township whereon was rained the fatal rain.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 25:41: And when they see thee (O Muhammad) they treat thee only as a jest (saying): Is this he whom Allah sendeth as a messenger ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 25:42: He would have led us far away from our gods if we had not been staunch to them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 25:43: Hast thou seen him who chooseth for his god his own lust ? Wouldst thou then be guardian over him ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 25:44: Or deemest thou that most of them hear or understand ? They are but as the cattle - nay, but they are farther astray ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 25:45: Hast thou not seen how thy Lord hath spread the shade - And if He willed He could have made it still - then We have made the sun its pilot;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 25:46: Then We withdraw it unto Us, a gradual withdrawal ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 25:47: And He it is Who maketh night a covering for you, and sleep repose, and maketh day a resurrection.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 25:48: And He it is Who sendeth the winds, glad tidings heralding His mercy, and We send down purifying water from the sky,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 25:49: That We may give life thereby to a dead land, and We give many beasts and men that We have created to drink thereof.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 25:50: And verily We have repeated it among them that they may remember, but most of mankind begrudge aught save ingratitude.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 25:51: If We willed, We could raise up a warner in every village.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 25:52: So obey not the disbelievers, but strive against them herewith with a great endeavour.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 25:53: And He it is Who hath given independence to the two seas (though they meet); one palatable, sweet, and the other saltish, bitter; and hath set a bar and a forbidding ban between them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 25:54: And He it is Who hath created man from water, and hath appointed for him kindred by blood and kindred by marriage; for thy Lord is ever Powerful.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 25:55: Yet they worship instead of Allah that which can neither benefit them nor hurt them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 25:56: And We have sent thee (O Muhammad) only as a bearer of good tidings and a warner.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 25:57: Say: I ask of you no reward for this, save that whoso will may choose a way unto his Lord.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 25:58: And trust thou in the Living One Who dieth not, and hymn His praise.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 25:59: Who created the heavens and the earth and all that is between them in six Days, then He mounted the Throne.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 25:60: And when it is said unto them: Adore the Beneficent! they say: And what is the Beneficent ? Are we to adore whatever thou (Muhammad) biddest us ? And it increaseth aversion in them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 25:61: Blessed be He Who hath placed in the heaven mansions of the stars, and hath placed therein a great lamp and a moon giving light!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 25:62: And He it is Who hath appointed night and day in succession, for him who desireth to remember, or desireth thankfulness.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 25:63: The (faithful) slaves of the Beneficent are they who walk upon the earth modestly, and when the foolish ones address them answer: Peace;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 25:64: And who spend the night before their Lord, prostrate and standing,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 25:65: And who say: Our Lord! Avert from us the doom of hell; lo! the doom thereof is anguish;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 25:66: Lo! it is wretched as abode and station;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 25:67: And those who, when they spend, are neither prodigal nor grudging; and there is ever a firm station between the two;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 25:68: And those who cry not unto any other god along with Allah, nor take the life which Allah hath forbidden save in (course of) justice, nor commit adultery - and whoso doeth this shall pay the penalty;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 25:69: The doom will be doubled for him on the Day of Resurrection, and he will abide therein disdained for ever;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 25:70: Save him who repenteth and believeth and doth righteous work; as for such, Allah will change their evil deeds to good deeds.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 25:71: And whosoever repenteth and doeth good, he verily repenteth toward Allah with true repentance -
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 25:72: And those who will not witness vanity, but when they pass near senseless play, pass by with dignity.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 25:73: And those who, when they are reminded of the revelations of their Lord, fall not deaf and blind thereat.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 25:74: And who say: Our Lord! Vouchsafe us comfort of our wives and of our offspring, and make us patterns for (all) those who ward off (evil).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 25:75: They will be awarded the high place forasmuch as they were steadfast, and they will meet therein with welcome and the ward of peace,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 25:77: Say (O Muhammad, unto the disbelievers): My Lord would not concern Himself with you but for your prayer.

Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:1: Blessed is He who sent down the criterion to His servant, that it may be an admonition to all creatures;-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:2: He to whom belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth: no son has He begotten, nor has He a partner in His dominion: it is He who created all things, and ordered them in due proportions.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:3: Yet have they taken, besides him, gods that can create nothing but are themselves created; that have no control of hurt or good to themselves; nor can they control death nor life nor resurrection.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:4: But the misbelievers say: "Naught is this but a lie which he has forged, and others have helped him at it.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:5: And they say: "Tales of the ancients, which he has caused to be written: and they are dictated before him morning and evening.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:6: Say: "The (Qur’an) was sent down by Him who knows the mystery (that is) in the heavens and the earth: verily He is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:7: And they say: "What sort of an apostle is this, who eats food, and walks through the streets? Why has not an angel been sent down to him to give admonition with him?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:8: "Or (Why) has not a treasure been bestowed on him, or why has he (not) a garden for enjoyment?" The wicked say: "Ye follow none other than a man bewitched.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:9: See what kinds of comparisons they make for thee! But they have gone astray, and never a way will they be able to find!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:10: Blessed is He who, if that were His will, could give thee better (things) than those,- Gardens beneath which rivers flow; and He could give thee palaces (secure to dwell in).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:11: Nay they deny the hour (of the judgment to come): but We have prepared a blazing fire for such as deny the hour:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:12: When it sees them from a place fAr off, they will hear its fury and its ranging sigh.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:13: And when they are cast, bound together into a constricted place therein, they will pLead for destruction there and then!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:14: "This day plead not for a single destruction: plead for destruction oft-repeated!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:15: Say: "Is that best, or the eternal garden, promised to the righteous? for them, that is a reward as well as a goal (of attainment).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:16: "For them there will be therein all that they wish for: they will dwell (there) for aye: A promise to be prayed for from thy Lord.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:17: The day He will gather them together as well as those whom they worship besides God, He will ask: "Was it ye who let these My servants astray, or did they stray from the Path themselves?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:18: They will say: "Glory to Thee! not meet was it for us that we should take for protectors others besides Thee: But Thou didst bestow, on them and their fathers, good things (in life), until they forgot the Message: for they were a people (worthless and) lost.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:19: (God will say): "Now have they proved you liars in what ye say: so ye cannot avert (your penalty) nor (get) help.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:20: And the apostles whom We sent before thee were all (men) who ate food and walked through the streets: We have made some of you as a trial for others: will ye have patience? for God is One Who sees (all things).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:21: Such as fear not the meeting with Us (for Judgment) say: "Why are not the angels sent down to us, or (why) do we not see our Lord?" Indeed they have an arrogant conceit of themselves, and mighty is the insolence of their impiety!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:22: The Day they see the angels,- no joy will there be to the sinners that Day: The (angels) will say: "There is a barrier forbidden (to you) altogether!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:23: And We shall turn to whatever deeds they did (in this life), and We shall make such deeds as floating dust scattered about.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:24: The Companions of the Garden will be well, that Day, in their abode, and have the fairest of places for repose.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:25: The Day the heaven shall be rent asunder with clouds, and angels shall be sent down, descending (in ranks),-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:26: That Day, the dominion as of right and truth, shall be (wholly) for (God) Most Merciful: it will be a Day of dire difficulty for the Misbelievers.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:27: The Day that the wrong-doer will bite at his hands, he will say, "Oh! would that I had taken a (straight) path with the Apostle!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:28: "Ah! woe is me! Would that I had never taken such a one for a friend!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:29: "He did lead me astray from the Message (of God) after it had come to me! Ah! the Evil One is but a traitor to man!" Then the Apostle will say:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:30: "O my Lord! Truly my people took this Qur’an for just foolish nonsense.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:31: Thus have We made for every prophet an enemy among the sinners: but enough is thy Lord to guide and to help.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:32: Those who reject Faith say: "Why is not the Qur’an revealed to him all at once? Thus (is it revealed), that We may strengthen thy heart thereby, and We have rehearsed it to thee in slow, well-arranged stages, gradually.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:33: And no question do they bring to thee but We reveal to thee the truth and the best explanation (thereof).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:34: Those who will be gathered to Hell (prone) on their faces,- they will be in an evil plight, and, as to Path, most astray.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:35: (Before this,) We sent Moses The Book, and appointed his brother Aaron with him as minister;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:36: And We command: "Go ye both, to the people who have rejected our Signs:" And those (people) We destroyed with utter destruction.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:37: And the people of Noah,- when they rejected the apostles, We drowned them, and We made them as a Sign for mankind; and We have prepared for (all) wrong-doers a grievous Penalty;-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:38: As also ’Ad and Thamud, and the Companions of the Rass, and many a generation between them.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:39: To each one We set forth Parables and examples; and each one We broke to utter annihilation (for their sins).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:40: And the (Unbelievers) must indeed have passed by the town on which was rained a shower of evil: did they not then see it (with their own eyes)? But they fear not the Resurrection.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:41: When they see thee, they treat thee no otherwise than in mockery: "Is this the one whom God has sent as an apostle?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:42: "He indeed would well-nigh have misled us from our gods, had it not been that we were constant to them!" - Soon will they know, when they see the Penalty, who it is that is most misled in Path!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:43: Seest thou such a one as taketh for his god his own passion (or impulse)? Couldst thou be a disposer of affairs for him?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:44: Or thinkest thou that most of them listen or understand? They are only like cattle;- nay, they are worse astray in Path.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:45: Hast thou not turned thy vision to thy Lord?- How He doth prolong the shadow! If He willed, He could make it stationary! then do We make the sun its guide;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:46: Then We draw it in towards Ourselves,- a contraction by easy stages.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:47: And He it is Who makes the Night as a Robe for you, and Sleep as Repose, and makes the Day (as it were) a Resurrection.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:48: And He it is Who sends the winds as heralds of glad tidings, going before His mercy, and We send down pure water from the sky,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:49: That with it We may give life to a dead land, and slake the thirst of things We have created,- cattle and men in great numbers.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:50: And We have distributed the (water) amongst them, in order that they may celebrate (our) praises, but most men are averse (to aught) but (rank) ingratitude.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:51: Had it been Our Will, We could have sent a warner to every centre of population.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:52: Therefore listen not to the Unbelievers, but strive against them with the utmost strenuousness, with the (Qur’an).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:53: It is He Who has let free the two bodies of flowing water: One palatable and sweet, and the other salt and bitter; yet has He made a barrier between them, a partition that is forbidden to be passed.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:54: It is He Who has created man from water: then has He established relationships of lineage and marriage: for thy Lord has power (over all things).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:55: Yet do they worship, besides God, things that can neither profit them nor harm them: and the Misbeliever is a helper (of Evil), against his own Lord!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:56: But thee We only sent to give glad tidings and admonition.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:57: Say: "No reward do I ask of you for it but this: that each one who will may take a (straight) Path to his Lord.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:58: And put thy trust in Him Who lives and dies not; and celebrate his praise; and enough is He to be acquainted with the faults of His servants;-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:59: He Who created the heavens and the earth and all that is between, in six days, and is firmly established on the Throne (of Authority): God Most Gracious: ask thou, then, about Him of any acquainted (with such things).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:60: When it is said to them, "Adore ye (God) Most Gracious!", they say, "And what is (God) Most Gracious? Shall we adore that which thou commandest us?" And it increases their flight (from the Truth).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:61: Blessed is He Who made constellations in the skies, and placed therein a Lamp and a Moon giving light;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:62: And it is He Who made the Night and the Day to follow each other: for such as have the will to celebrate His praises or to show their gratitude.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:63: And the servants of (God) Most Gracious are those who walk on the earth in humility, and when the ignorant address them, they say, "Peace!";
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:64: Those who spend the night in adoration of their Lord prostrate and standing;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:65: Those who say, "Our Lord! avert from us the Wrath of Hell, for its Wrath is indeed an affliction grievous,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:66: "Evil indeed is it as an abode, and as a place to rest in";
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:67: Those who, when they spend, are not extravagant and not niggardly, but hold a just (balance) between those (extremes);
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:68: Those who invoke not, with God, any other god, nor slay such life as God has made sacred except for just cause, nor commit fornication; - and any that does this (not only) meets punishment.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:69: (But) the Penalty on the Day of Judgment will be doubled to him, and he will dwell therein in ignominy,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:70: Unless he repents, believes, and works righteous deeds, for God will change the evil of such persons into good, and God is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:71: And whoever repents and does good has truly turned to God with an (acceptable) conversion;-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:72: Those who witness no falsehood, and, if they pass by futility, they pass by it with honourable (avoidance);
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:73: Those who, when they are admonished with the Signs of their Lord, droop not down at them as if they were deaf or blind;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:74: And those who pray, "Our Lord! Grant unto us wives and offspring who will be the comfort of our eyes, and give us (the grace) to lead the righteous.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:75: Those are the ones who will be rewarded with the highest place in heaven, because of their patient constancy: therein shall they be met with salutations and peace,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:76: Dwelling therein;- how beautiful an abode and place of rest!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 25:77: Say (to the Rejecters): "My Lord is not uneasy because of you if ye call not on Him: But ye have indeed rejected (Him), and soon will come the inevitable (punishment)!"

Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:1: Blessed be He who has sent down the Salvation upon His servant, that he may be a warner to all beings;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:2: to whom belongs the Kingdom of the heavens and the earth; and He has not taken to Him a son, and He has no associate in the Kingdom; and He created every thing, then He ordained it very exactly.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:3: Yet they have taken to them gods, apart from Him, that create nothing and themselves are created, and have no power to hurt or profit themselves, no power of death or life or raising up.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:4: The unbelievers say, ’This is naught but a calumny he has forged, and other folk have helped him to it.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:5: They say, ’Fairy-tales of the ancients that he has had written down, so that they are recited to him at the dawn and in the evening.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:6: Say: ’He sent it down, who knows the secret in the heavens and earth; He is All-forgiving, All-compassionate.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:7: They also say, ’What ails this Messenger that he eats food, and goes in the markets? Why has an angel not been sent down to him, to be a warner with him?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:8: Or why is not a treasure thrown to him, or why has he not a Garden to eat of?’ The evildoers say, ’You are only following a man bewitched!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:9: Behold, how they strike similitudes for thee, and go astray, and are unable to find a way!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:10: Blessed be He who, if He will, shall assign to them better than that -- gardens underneath which rivers flow, and he shall assign to thee palaces.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:11: Nay, but they cry lies to the Hour; and We have prepared for him who cries lies to the Hour a Blaze.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:12: When it sees them from a far place, they shall hear its bubbling and sighing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:13: And when they are cast, coupled in fetters, into a narrow place of that Fire, they will call out there for destruction.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:14: ’Call not out today for one destruction, but call for many!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:15: Say: ’Is that better, or the Garden of Eternity, that is promised to the godfearing, and is their recompense and homecoming?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:16: Therein they shall have what they will dwelling forever; it is a promise binding upon thy Lord, and of Him to be required.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:17: Upon the day when He shall muster them and that they serve, apart from God, and He shall say, ’Was it you that led these My servants astray, or did they themselves err from the way?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:18: They shall ’Glory be to Thee! It did not behove us to take unto say, ourselves protectors apart from Thee; but Thou gavest them and their fathers enjoyment of days, until they forgot
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:19: the Remembrance, and were a people corrupt.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:20: And We sent not before thee any Envoys, but that they ate food, and went in the markets; and We appointed some of you to be a trial for others: ’Will you endure?’ Thy Lord is ever All-seeing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:21: Say those who look not to encounter Us, ’Why have the angels not been sent down on us, or why see we not our Lord?’ Waxed proud they have within them, and become greatly disdainful.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:22: Upon the day that they see the angels, no good tidings that day for the sinners; they shall say, ’A ban forbidden!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:23: We shall advance upon what work they have done, and make it a scattered dust.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:24: The inhabitants of Paradise that day, better shall be their lodging, fairer their resting-place.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:25: Upon the day that heaven is split asunder with the clouds and the angels are sent down in majesty,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:26: the Kingdom that day, the true Kingdom, shall belong to the All-merciful and it shall be a day harsh for the unbelievers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:27: Upon the day the evildoer shall bite his hands, saying, ’Would that I had taken a way along with the Messenger!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:28: Alas, would that I had not taken So-and-so for a friend!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:29: He indeed led me astray from the Remembrance, after it had come to me; Satan is ever a forsaker of men.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:30: The Messenger says, ’O my Lord, behold, my people have taken this Koran as a thing to be shunned.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:31: Even so We have appointed to every Prophet an enemy among the sinners; but thy Lord suffices as a guide and as a helper.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:32: The unbelievers say, ’Why has the Koran not been sent down upon him all at once?’ Even so, that We may strengthen thy heart thereby, and We have chanted it very distinctly.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:33: They bring not to thee any similitude but that We bring thee the truth, and better in exposition.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:34: Those who shall be mustered to Gehenna upon their faces -- they shall be worse in place, and gone further astray from the way.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:35: We gave Moses the Book, and appointed with him his brother Aaron as minister
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:36: and We said, ’Go to the people who have cried lies to Our signs’; then We destroyed them utterly.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:37: And the people of Noah, when they cried lies to the Messengers, We drowned them, and made them to be a sign to mankind; and We have prepared for the evildoers a painful chastisement.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:38: And Ad, and Thamood, and the men of Er-Rass, and between that generations a many,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:39: for each We struck similitudes, and each We ruined utterly.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:40: Surely they have come by the city that was rained on by an evil rain; what, have they not seen it? Nay, but they look for no upraising.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:41: And when they see thee, they take thee in mockery only: ’What, is this he whom God sent forth as a Messenger?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:42: Wellnigh he had led us astray from our gods, but that we kept steadfast to them.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:43: Hast thou seen him who has taken his caprice to be his god? Wilt thou be a guardian over them?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:44: Or deemest thou that most of them hear or understand? They are but as the cattle; nay, they are further astray from the way.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:45: Hast thou not regarded thy Lord, how He has stretched out the shadow? Had He willed, He would have made it still.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:46: thereafter We seize it to Ourselves, drawing it gently.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:47: It is He who appointed the night for you to be a garment and sleep for a rest, and day He appointed for a rising.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:48: And it is He who has loosed the winds, bearing good tidings before His mercy; and We sent down from heaven pure water
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:49: so that We might revive a dead land, and give to drink of it, of that We created, cattle and men a many.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:50: We have indeed turned it about amongst them, so that they may remember; yet most men refuse all but unbelief.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:51: If We had willed, We would have raised up in every city a warner.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:52: So obey not the unbelievers, but struggle with them thereby mightily.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:53: And it is He who let forth the two seas, this one Sweet, grateful to taste, and this salt, bitter to the tongue, and He set between them a barrier, and a ban forbidden.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:54: And it is He who created of water a mortal, and made him kindred of blood and marriage; thy Lord is All-powerful.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:55: And they serve, apart from God, what neither profits them nor hurts them; and the unbeliever is ever a partisan against his Lord.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:56: We have sent thee not, except good tidings to bear, and warning.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:57: Say: ’I do not ask of you a wage for this, except for him who wishes to take to his Lord a way.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:58: Put thy trust in the Living God, the Undying, and proclaim His praise.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:59: who created the heavens and the earth, and what between them is, in six days, then sat Himself upon the Throne, the All-compassionate: ask any informed of Him!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:60: But when they are told, ’Bow yourselves to the All-merciful,’ they say, ’And what is the All-merciful? Shall we bow ourselves to what thou biddest us?’ And it increases them in aversion.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:61: Blessed be He who has set in heaven constellations, and has set among them a lamp, and an illuminating moon.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:62: And it is He who made the night and day a succession for whom He desires to remember or He desires to be thankful.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:63: The servants of the All-merciful are those who walk in the earth modestly and who, when the ignorant address them, say, ’Peace’;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:64: who pass the night prostrate to their Lord and standing;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:65: who say, ’Our Lord, turn Thou from us the chastisement of Gehenna; surely its chastisement is torment most terrible;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:66: evil it is as a lodging-place and an abode’;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:67: who, when they expend, are neither prodigal nor parsimonious, but between that is a just stand;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:68: who call not upon another god with God, nor slay the soul God has forbidden except by right, neither fornicate, for whosoever does that shall meet the price
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:69: of sin-doubled shall be the chastisement for him on the Resurrection Day, and he shall dwell therein humbled,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:70: save him who repents, and believes, and does righteous work -- those, God will change their evil deeds into good deeds, for God is ever All-forgiving, All-compassionate;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:71: and whosoever repents, and does righteousness, he truly turns to God in repentance.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:72: And those who bear not false witness and, when they pass by idle talk, pass by with dignity;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:73: who, when they are reminded of the signs of their Lord, fall not down thereat deaf and blind;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:74: who say, ’Our Lord, give us refreshment of our wives and seed, and make us a model to the godfearing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:75: Those shall be recompensed with the highest heaven, for that they endured patiently, and they shall receive therein a greeting and --’ Peace!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:76: Therein they shall dwell forever; fair it is as a lodging-place and an abode.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 25:77: Say: ’My Lord esteems you not at all were it not for your prayer, for you have cried lies, and it shall surely be fastened.

Muhammad Asad.verse 25:1: HALLOWED is He who from on high, step by step, has bestowed upon His servant the standard by which to discern the true from the false, so that to all the world it might be a warning:
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:2: He to whom the dominion over the heavens and the earth belongs, and who begets no offspring, and has no partner in His dominion: for it is He who creates every thing and determines its nature in accordance with [His own] design.
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:3: And yet, some choose to worship, instead of Him,
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:4: deities that cannot create anything but are themselves created, and have it not within their power to avert harm from, or bring benefit to, themselves, and have no power over death, nor over life, nor over resurrection!
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:5: Moreover, those who are bent on denying the truth are wont to say, "This
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:6: is nothing but a lie which he
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:7: has devised with the help of other people, who thereupon have perverted the truth and brought a falsehood into being.
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:8: And they say, "Fables of ancient times which he has caused to be written down, so that they might be read out to him at morn and evening!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:9: Say [O Muhammad]: "He who knows all the mysteries of the heavens and the earth has bestowed from on high this [Qur’ān upon me]! Verily, He is much-forgiving, a dispenser of grace!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:10: Yet they say: "What sort of apostle is this
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:11: who eats food [like all other mortals] and goes about in the market-places? Why has not an angel
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:12: been sent down unto him, to act as a warner together with him?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:13: Or: "[Why has not] a treasure been granted to him [by God]?" Or: "He should [at least] have a
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:14: garden, so that he could eat thereof [without effort]!" And so these evildoers say [unto one another], "If you were to follow [Muhammad, you would follow] but a man bewitched!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:15: See to what they liken thee, [O Prophet, simply] because they have gone astray and are now unable to find a way [to the truth]!
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:16: Hallowed is He who, if it be His will, shall give thee something better than that [whereof they speak] – gardens through which running waters flow – and shall assign to thee mansions [of bliss in the life to come].
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:17: But nay! It is [the very coming of] the Last Hour to which they give the lie! However, for such as give the lie to [the announcement of] the Last Hour We have readied a blazing flame:
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:18: when it shall face them from afar, they will hear its angry roar and its hiss;
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:19: and when they are flung, linked
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:20: together, into a tight space within, they will pray for extinction there and then!
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:21: [But they will be told:] "Pray not today for one single extinction, but pray for many extinctions!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:22: Say: "Which is better – that, or the paradise of life abiding which has been promised to the God-conscious as their reward and their journey’s end
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:24: they shall have whatever they may desire, therein to abide – a promise given by thy Sustainer,
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:26: BUT [as for people who are oblivious of thy Sustainer’s oneness –] one Day He will gather them together with all that they
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:27: worship instead of God, and will ask [those to whom divinity was falsely ascribed]: "Was it you who led these My creatures astray, or did they by themselves stray from the right path?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:28: They will answer: "Limitless art Thou in Thy glory! It was inconceivable for us to take for our masters anyone but Thyself! But [as for them –] Thou didst allow them and their forefathers to enjoy [the pleasures of] life to such an extent that they forgot all remembrance [of thee]: for they were people devoid of all good.
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:29: [Thereupon God will say:] "And now, they [whom you regarded as divine] have given the lie to all your
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:30: assertions, and you can neither ward off [your punishment] nor obtain any succour! For whoever of you has committed
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:31: evil, him shall We cause to taste great suffering!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:33: before thee, [O Muhammad,] We never sent as Our message-bearers any but [mortal men,] who indeed ate food [like other human beings] and went about in the market-places: for [it is thus that] We cause you [human beings] to be a means of testing one another.
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:34: But those who do not believe that they are destined to meet Us are wont to say, "Why have no angels been sent down to us?" – or, "Why do we not see our Sustainer?" Indeed, they are far too proud of themselves, having rebelled [against God’s truth] with utter disdain!
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:36: on that Day – the Day on which they shall see the angels – there will be no glad tiding for those who were lost in sin; and they will exclaim, "By a forbidding ban [are we from God’s grace debarred]!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:37: for We shall have turned towards all the [supposedly good] deeds they ever wrought, and shall have transformed them into scattered dust
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:39: on that same Day those who are destined for paradise will be graced with the best of abodes and the fairest place of repose.
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:40: And on the Day on which the skies, together with the clouds, shall burst asunder, and the angels are made to descend in a mighty descent
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:41: on that Day [it will become obvious to all that] true sovereignty belongs to the Most Gracious :
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:42: hence, a Day of distress will it be for all who deny the truth,
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:43: and a Day on which the evildoer will bite his hands [in despair], exclaiming: "Oh, would that I had followed the path shown to me by the apostle!
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:44: Oh, woe is me! Would that I had not taken so-and-so for a friend!
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:45: Indeed, he led me astray from the remembrance [of God] after it had come unto me!" For [thus it is:] Satan is ever a betrayer of man.
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:46: AND [on that Day] the Apostle will say: "O my Sustainer! Behold, [some of] my people have come to regard this Qur’ān as something [that ought to be] discarded!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:47: For so it is that against every prophet We have set up enemies from among those who are lost in sin: yet none can guide and give succour as thy Sustainer does!
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:48: Now they who are bent on denying the truth are wont to ask, "Why has not the Qur’ān been bestowed on him from on high in one single revelation?" [It has been revealed] in this manner so that We might strengthen thy heart thereby – for We have so arranged its component parts that they form one consistent whole
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:50: they [who deny the truth] might never taunt thee with any deceptive half-truth without Our conveying to thee the
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:51: truth and [providing thee] with the best explanation.
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:52: [And so, tell those who are bent on denying the truth that] they who shall be gathered unto hell upon their faces – it is they who [in the life to come] will be worst in station and still farther astray from the path [of truth]!
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:53: AND, INDEED, [long before Muhammad] We vouchsafed revelation unto Moses, and appointed his brother Aaron to help him to bear his burden;
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:54: and We said, "Go you both unto the people who have given the lie to Our messages!"-and thereupon We broke those
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:56: And [think of] the people of Noah: when they gave the lie to [one of] the apostles, We caused them to drown, and made them a symbol for all mankind: for grievous suffering have We readied for all who
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:58: And [remember how We punished the tribes of ’ād and Thamūd, and the people of Ar-Rass, and many generations [of sinners] in-between:
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:59: and unto each of them did We proffer lessons, and each of them did We destroy with utter destruction.
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:60: And they [who now deny Our messages] must surely have come across that town which was rained upon by a rain of evil: have they, then, never beheld it [with their mind’s eye]? But nay, they would not believe in resurrection!
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:61: Hence, whenever they consider thee, [O Muhammad,] they but make thee a target of their mockery,
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:62: "Is this the one whom God has sent as an apostle?
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:63: Indeed, he would well-nigh have led us astray from our deities, had we not been
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:64: steadfastly attached to them!" But in time, when they see the suffering [that awaits them], they will come to know who it was that went farthest astray from the path [of truth]!
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:65: Hast thou ever considered [the kind of man] who makes his own desires his deity? Couldst thou, then, [O Prophet,] be held responsible for him?
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:66: Or dost thou think that most of them listen [to thy message] and use their reason? Nay, they are but like cattle – nay, they are even less conscious of the right way!
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:67: ART THOU NOT aware of thy Sustainer [through His works]? – how He causes the shadow to lengthen [towards the night] when, had He so willed, He could indeed have made it stand still: but then, We have made the sun its guide;
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:68: and then, [after having caused it to lengthen,] We draw it in towards Ourselves with a gradual drawing-in.
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:69: And He it is who makes the night a garment for you, and
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:70: sleep a rest, and causes every
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:72: And He it is who sends forth the winds as a glad tiding of His coming grace; and [thus, too,] We cause pure water to descend from the skies,
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:73: so that We may bring dead land to life thereby, and give to drink thereof to many
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:74: of Our creation, beasts as well as humans.
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:75: And, indeed, many times have We repeated
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:76: this unto men, so that they might take it to heart: but most men refuse to be aught but ingrate.
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:77: Now had We so willed, We could have [continued as before and] raised up a
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:79: hence, do not defer to [the likes and dislikes of] those who deny the truth, but strive hard against them, by means of this [divine writ], with utmost striving.
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:80: AND HE it is who has given freedom of movement to the two great bodies of water – the one sweet and thirst-allaying, and the other salty and bitter – and yet has wrought between them a barrier and a forbidding ban.
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:81: And He it is who out of this
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:82: water has created man, and has endowed him with [the consciousness of] descent and marriage-tie: for thy Sustainer is ever infinite in His power.
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:83: And yet, some people worship, instead of God, things that can neither benefit them nor harm them: thus, he who denies the truth does indeed turn his back on his Sustainer!
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:84: Yet [withal, O Prophet,] We have sent thee only as a herald of glad tidings and a warner.
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:85: Say: "For this, no reward do I ask of you [– no reward] other than that he who so wills may unto his Sustainer find a way!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:86: Hence, place thy trust in the Living One who dies not, and extol His limitless glory and praise: for none is as aware of His creatures’ sins as He
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:87: He who has created the heavens and the earth and all that is between them in six aeons, and is established on the throne of His almightiness: the Most Gracious! Ask, then, about Him,
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:90: Yet when they [who are bent on denying the truth] are told, "Prostrate yourselves before the Most Gracious," they are wont to ask, "And [who and] what is the Most Gracious? Are we to prostrate ourselves before whatever thou biddest us [to worship]?" – and so [thy call] but increases their aversion.
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:91: HALLOWED is He who has set up in the skies great constellations, and has placed among them a
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:93: And He it is who causes the night and the day to succeed one another, [revealing Himself in His works] unto him who has the will to take thought – that is, has the will to be grateful.
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:95: servants of the Most Gracious are
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:96: they who walk gently on earth, and who, whenever the foolish address them, reply with [words of] peace;
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:97: and who remember their Sustainer far into the night, prostrating themselves and standing;
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:98: and who pray: "O our Sustainer, avert from us the suffering of hell – for, verily, the suffering caused by it is bound to be a torment dire:
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:99: verily, how evil an abode and a station!";
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:100: and who, whenever they spend on others, are neither wasteful nor niggardly but [remember that] there is always a just mean between those [two extremes];
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:102: deity side by side with God, and do not take any human being’s life – [the life] which God has willed to be sacred – otherwise than in [the pursuit of] justice, and do not commit adultery.
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:104: shall have his suffering doubled on Resurrection Day: for on that
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:106: Excepted, however, shall be they who repent and attain to faith and do righteous deeds: for it is they whose
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:107: bad deeds God will transform into good ones – seeing that God is indeed much-forgiving, a dispenser of grace,
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:108: and seeing that he who repents and
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:109: does what is right has truly turned unto God by [this very act of] repentance.
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:110: And [know that true servants of God are only] those who never bear witness to what is false, and ,
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:111: whenever they pass by [people engaged in] frivolity, pass on with dignity;
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:112: and who, whenever they are reminded of their Sustainer’s messages, do not throw themselves upon them [as if] deaf and blind;
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:113: and who pray: "O our Sustainer! Grant that our spouses and our offspring be a joy to our eyes, and cause us to be foremost among those who are conscious of Thee!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:114: [Such as] these will be rewarded for all their patient endurance [in life] with a high station [in paradise], and will be met therein with a greeting of welcome and peace,
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:116: how goodly an abode and [how high] a station!
Muhammad Asad.verse 25:117: SAY [unto those who believe]: "No weight or value would my Sustainer attach to you were it not for your faith [in Him]!" [And say unto those who deny the truth:] "You have indeed given the lie [to God’s message], and in time this

Martin Lings.verse 25:1: Blessed be He Who hath made the distinct revelation unto His servant, that he might be for all the worlds a warner.
Martin Lings.verse 25:2: …the Garden of Immortality which is promised to the pious.
Martin Lings.verse 25:3: For them therein is that which they desire, for ever and ever- a promise that thy Lord hath bound Himself to fulfil.
Martin Lings.verse 25:4: They who place not their hopes in meeting Us say: Why are the angels not sent down unto us? Or why see we not our Lord? Verily they are proud with pride in themselves, and arrogant with a great arrogance.
Martin Lings.verse 25:5: The day they behold the angels, on that day there will be no good tidings for the evil-doers, and they will say: A barrier that bars!
Martin Lings.verse 25:6: …and We have sent down from Heaven pure water.
Martin Lings.verse 25:7: That thereof We may quicken a dead land, and that thereof We may give drink to Our creatures to cattle and men in plenty.
Martin Lings.verse 25:8: And verily We have given of it freely unto them that they might remember.
Martin Lings.verse 25:9: And He it is Who hath let loose the two seas, one sweet and fresh, the other salt and bitter, and hath set between them an isthmus, an impassable barrier.
Martin Lings.verse 25:10: sweet fresh water sea…the brackish salt sea….
Martin Lings.verse 25:11: sweet and fresh, the other salt and bitter….
Martin Lings.verse 25:12: sweet and fresh, the other salted and bitter….
Martin Lings.verse 25:13: And He it is Who from water hath created man.
Martin Lings.verse 25:14: Blessed is He who hath placed in the heavens the constellations of the zodiac, and hath placed therein a lamp and a light-giving moon.
Martin Lings.verse 25:15: And He it is who hath made the night and the day to succeed one the other, as a sign for him who would reflect or give thanks.
Martin Lings.verse 25:16: …God will change their evils into goods, and God is All-Forgiving, All-Merciful.

Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:1: Glorious is the One who has revealed the Criterion to His servant, so that he may be a warner to all the worlds,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:2: the One to whom belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth, and who did neither have a son, nor is there any partner to him in the Kingdom, and who has created everything and designed it in a perfect measure.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:3: Yet they have adopted other gods, beside Him, who do not create any thing, as they themselves are created, and they possess no power to cause harm or benefit even to themselves, nor do they have any control over death or life or resurrection.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:4: The disbelievers said, “This is nothing but a lie he (the messenger) has fabricated and some other people have helped him in it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:5: And they said, “(These are) the tales of the ancients he (the messenger) has caused to be written, and they are read out to him at morn and eve.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:6: Say, “It is sent down by the One who knows the secret in the heavens and the earth.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:7: They said, “What sort of messenger is this who eats food and walks in the markets? Why is it that an angel has not been sent down to him who would have been a warner along with him.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:8: Or a treasure should have been thrown down to him, or he should have a garden to eat from it?” And the transgressors said (to the believers,) “You are following none but a bewitched man.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:9: See how they coined similes for you, so they have gone astray and cannot find a way.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:10: Glorious is the One who, if He so wills, would give you better than that - gardens beneath which rivers flow, and would give you palaces.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:11: But they have disbelieved the Hour (the Day of Judgment) and for those who disbelieve the Hour, We have prepared a flaming fire.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:12: When it will see them from a distant place, they will hear (the sounds of) its raging and breathing,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:13: and when they will be thrown into a narrow place therein, while they will be chained together, they will call for death.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:14: (Then it will be said to them,) “Do not call for one death today, but call for many a death.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:15: Say, “Is that better or the eternal paradise the God-fearing are promised?” It will be a reward for them and a final abode.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:16: For them there will be whatever they wish, while they will be eternal.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:17: (Remember) the Day when He will gather them and what they used to worship beside Allah and will say (to the latter ones), “Did you mislead these My servants, or did they themselves lose the way?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:19: Thus they will refute you in what you say, and you will not be able to repulse (the punishment,) or to receive help.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:20: We did not send any messengers before you (O prophet,) but all of them used to eat food and walk in the markets.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:21: Said those who do not even expect to meet Us, “Why the angels are not sent down to us or why do we not see our Lord?” Indeed they think too highly of themselves, and have gone too far in rebellion.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:22: The Day they will see the angels, there will be no good news for the sinners that day, and they will say, “(We need) a shelter, fully protected!”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:23: And We will proceed to whatever deeds they did, and will turn them into scattered dust.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:24: The people of Paradise, on that day, will be the best in (terms of their) abode and best in (terms of their) resting-place.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:25: The Day the sky will break open with a cloud, and the angels will be sent down in a majestic descent,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:26: the Kingdom on that day will be for the RaHmān (the All-Merciful, Allah), and it will be a difficult day for the disbelievers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:27: And (Be mindful of) the Day the wrongdoer will bite his hands saying, “Would that I had taken a path along with the messenger!
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:28: Woe to me! Would that I had not taken so-and-so for my friend!
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:29: Indeed he led me astray from the advice after it had come to me.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:30: And the messenger will say, “O my Lord, my people had taken this Qur’ān as deserted.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:31: In a similar way We made for every prophet an enemy from among the sinners, but your Lord suffices as a guide and as a supporter.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:32: Said those who disbelieved, “Why has the Qur’ān not been revealed to him all at once?” (It has been sent down) in this way (i.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:33: They bring to you no hypothesis, but We bring to you the correct position and (an answer) better explained.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:34: Those who will be driven on their faces to Hell - they are the worst in situation and far more astray from the path.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:35: Surely We gave Mūsā the Book, and appointed his brother Hārūn as a minister with him.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:36: So we said, “Go, both of you, to the people who have rejected Our signs” Then We annihilated them totally.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:37: As for the people of NūH, when they rejected the messengers, We drowned them and made them an example for mankind, and We have prepared a painful punishment for the transgressors.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:38: And (We annihilated also the peoples of) ‘Ād and Thamūd and the people of Rass, and many generations in between them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:39: To each (of them) We cited examples, and each of them We brought to utter ruin.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:40: Indeed they (the pagans of Makkah) have passed by the town that was afflicted by an evil rain sent down to it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:41: When they see you, they take you only as a laughing stock, (saying) “Is this the man whom Allah has sent as a messenger?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:42: He would have almost led us astray from our gods, had we not been so firm towards them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:43: Tell me about the one who has taken his desire as his god, would you then, become a guardian for him?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:44: Or do you think that most of them listen or understand? They are but like cattle.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:45: Have you not observed how your Lord stretched out the shadow (of the sun)? If He so willed, He would have made it stand still.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:46: Then We pulled it toward Us in a gradual manner.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:47: He is the One who has made the night an apparel for you, and the sleep a means of rest, and has made the day a means of revival.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:48: And He is the One who has sent the winds conveying good news before His mercy, and We have sent down purifying water from the heavens,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:49: so that We revive a dead land therewith, and give drink to the many cattle and humans created by Us.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:50: And We have distributed it (the water) among them, so that they may take lesson.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:51: Had We so willed, We would have sent a (separate) warner for every town, (but, according to Our wisdom, We have sent Muhammad as a prophet for all these towns)
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:52: So, (O Prophet,) do not obey the infidels, and strive against them with it (the Qur’ān), in utmost endeavor.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:53: He is the One who joined the two seas, so as this is sweet, very sweet, and this is bitter, very bitter, and made between them a buffer and an insurmountable barrier.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:54: And He is the One who created man from water, then made of him relations created by lineage and relations created by marriage.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:55: They worship, instead of Allah, what can neither give them any benefit nor can cause them any harm.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:56: We did not send you but as a bearer of good news and as a warner.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:57: Say, “I do not demand from you any return, except that one should adopt the (proper) way to his Lord, if he so wills.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:58: And place your trust in the Ever-Living who cannot die, and proclaim His purity along with His praise.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:59: the One who created in six days the heavens and the earth and whatever lies between them, then He positioned Himself on the Throne.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:60: And when it is said to them, “Prostrate yourselves to the RaHmān (the All-Merciful, Allah),” they say “What is RaHmān? Shall we prostrate ourselves to the one to whom you direct us?” And it increases nothing in them except aversion.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:61: Glorious is the One who made stellar formations in the sky, and placed therein a lamp (i.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:62: And He is the One who made the day and the night following each other, for the one who wishes to be mindful or wishes to show gratitude.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:63: The servants of the RaHmān (the All-Merciful, Allah) are those who walk on the earth humbly, and when the ignorant people speak to them, they reply peacefully,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:64: and those who pass the night prostrating themselves and standing before their Lord,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:65: and those who say, “Our Lord, avert from us the punishment of Jahannam (the Hell); indeed, its punishment is a persisting affliction.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:66: Indeed, it is evil as an abode and a place to dwell in
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:67: - and those who, when they spend, are neither extravagant nor miserly, and it (i.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:68: - and those who do not invoke any other god along with Allah, and do not kill a person whom Allah has given sanctity, except rightfully, nor do they fornicate; and whoever does it, shall face the recompense of his sin,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:69: the punishment will be doubled for him, and he will remain there disdained, for ever,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:70: except the one who repents and believes and does good deeds, then Allah will replace the evils of such people by good deeds, and Allah is Most-Forgiving, Very-Merciful.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:71: Whoever repents and does righteous deeds turns to Allah truly
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:72: - and those who do not witness falsehood, and when they pass by the absurd things, Pass by them with dignity,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:73: and those who, when they are reminded of the verses of their Lord, do not fall at them as deaf and blind ones,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:74: - and those who say, “Our Lord, Give us, from our spouses and our children, comfort of eyes, and make us heads of the God-fearing.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:75: Such people will be rewarded with the high place - because they observed patience - and will be received therein with prayers of their eternal life and peace,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:76: living in it (the Paradise) for ever.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 25:77: Say (O Prophet), “My Lord will never care about you, if you will not invoke Him.

Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:1: Blessed is He Who revealed the Criterion to His servant that he may be to all the worlds a warner.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:2: He to Whom belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth, and Who has not taken a son, nor has He any partner in sovereignty; and He created everything, and then determined it in a precise measure.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:3: Yet they have taken besides Him gods, who create nothing but have themselves been created, and who possess no harm for themselves, nor any benefit, nor do they possess [any power over] death or life, or resurrection.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:4: And those who disbelieve say, 'This is nothing but a calumny that he has invented, and other folk have helped him with it'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:6: And they say, 'Fables of the ancients which he has had written down so that they are read to him morning and evening'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:7: Say: 'It has been revealed by Him Who knows the secret of the heavens and the earth.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:8: And they also say, 'What is it with this Messenger that he eats food and walks about in the marketplaces? Why has an angel not been sent down to him so as to be a warner along with him?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:9: Or [why is it not] a treasure thrown down to him, or [why has he not] a garden for him to eat from?' The wrongdoers say, 'You are just following a man bewitched!'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:10: See how they strike similitudes for you, so that they go astray and are unable to find a way.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:11: Blessed is He Who, if He will, will give you better than that — gardens underneath which rivers flow, and will give you palaces.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:12: Nay, but they deny the [coming of the] Hour, and We have prepared for those who deny the Hour a blaze.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:13: When it sees them from a distant place, they will hear it raging and roaring.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:14: And when they are flung into a narrow place thereof bound together, they will at that point pray for [their own] annihilation.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:15: 'Do not pray for a single annihilation on this day, but pray for many annihilations!'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:16: Say: 'Is that better, or the Garden of Immortality which has been promised to the God-fearing, which will be their requital and journey's end?'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:17: In it they shall have what they wish, abiding
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:18: - it is a promise binding on your Lord, [a promise] much besought.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:19: And on the day when He will assemble them and that which they worship besides God, and will say, 'Was it you who misled these servants of Mine, or did they go astray from the way?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:20: They will say, 'Glory be to You! It was not for us to take any guardians besides You.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:21: Thus they will deny you in what you allege, and they will neither be able to circumvent, nor help.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:22: And We did not send before you any messengers but that they ate food and walked in the marketplaces.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:23: And those who do not expect to encounter Us say, 'Why have the angels not been sent down to us, or why do we not see our Lord?' Assuredly they are full of arrogance within their souls and have become terribly insolent.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:24: The day when they see the angels, there will be no good tidings on that day for the guilty, and they will say, 'A forbidding ban!'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:25: And We shall attend to the works they did and turn them into scattered dust.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:26: Those who will be the inhabitants of Paradise on that day will be in a
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:29: And on the day when the heaven will be split asunder with the clouds, and the angels will be sent down in a
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:31: true Sovereignty on that day will belong to the Compassionate One, and it will be a hard day for the disbelievers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:32: And [it will be] a day when the wrongdoer will bite his hands, saying, 'O would that I had followed a way with the Messenger!
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:33: O Woe is me! Would that I had not taken so and so as friend!
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:34: Verily he has led me astray from the Remembrance after it had come to me: And Satan is ever a deserter of man'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:35: And the Messenger says, ‘O my Lord, lo! my people consider this Qur’ān as something to be shunned’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:36: So We have appointed to every prophet an enemy from among the guilty, but your Lord suffices as a Guide and a Helper.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:37: And those who disbelieve say, ‘Why has the Qur’ān not been revealed to him all at once?’ Thus, [it is], that We may strengthen your inner-heart with it, and We have arranged it in a specific order.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:38: And they do not bring you any similitude, but that We bring you the truth, and [what is] better
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:40: Those who will be gathered on their faces toward Hell: they will be in the worst place and furthest astray from the way.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:41: And verily We gave Moses the Scripture, and made Aaron, his brother,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:43: Then We said, 'Go both of you to the people who have denied Our signs'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:44: And the people of Noah, when they denied the messengers - We drowned them and made them a sign for mankind, and We have prepared for the evildoers a painful chastisement.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:45: And ‘ād and Thamūd, and the dwellers at al-Rass, and many generations in between.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:46: For each [of them] We struck similitudes, and each [of them] We ruined utterly.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:47: And verily they will have passed by the town on which an evil shower was rained.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:48: And when they see you, they take you in mockery only, 'Is this the one whom God has sent as a messenger?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:49: Indeed he was about to lead us astray from our gods, had we not stood by them'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:50: Have you seen him who has taken as his god his own desire? Will you be a guardian over him?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:51: Or do you suppose that most of them listen or comprehend? They are but as the cattle - nay, but they are further astray from the way.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:52: Have you not seen your Lord, how He extends the
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:53: shadow? For had He willed, He would have made it still.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:54: Then We retract it to Us by gentle retraction.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:55: And He it is Who made for you the night as a garment, and sleep for repose, and He made the day for rising.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:56: And He it is Who sends forth the winds dispersing before His mercy, and We send down from the heaven purifying water
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:57: with which We revive a dead land and We give it as drink to the many cattle and humans We have created.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:58: And verily We have distributed it among them, so that they may remember.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:59: And had We willed, We could have sent forth in every town a warner.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:60: So do not obey the disbelievers, but struggle against them therewith with a great endeavour.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:61: And He it is Who merged the two seas: this one palatable, sweet, and the other saltish, bitter; and He set between the two an isthmus, and a forbidding ban.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:62: And He it is Who created man from water, and made for him ties of blood and ties of marriage.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:63: And they worship besides God that which neither benefits them, nor harms them; and the disbeliever is ever a partisan against his Lord.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:64: And We have not sent you except as a bearer of good tidings, and as a warner.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:65: Say: 'I do not ask of you in return for this any reward, except that whoever wishes to follow a way to his Lord [should do so]'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:66: And put your trust in the Living One Who does not die, and make glorifications in His praise.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:67: Who created the heavens and the earth and all that is between them in six days, then presided upon the Throne.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:68: And when it is said to them, 'Prostrate yourselves before the Compassionate One', they say, 'And what is the Compassionate One? Should we prostrate ourselves to whatever you bid us?' And it increases their aversion.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:69: Blessed is He Who has placed in the heaven constellations and has placed in it a lamp and a shining moon.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:70: And He it is Who made the night and day [to appear] in succession for him who desires to remember or desires to be thankful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:72: servants of the Compassionate One are those who walk upon the earth modestly, and who, when the ignorant address them, say [words of] peace;
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:73: and who spend the night before their Lord, prostrating and standing [in worship],
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:74: and who say, 'Our Lord, avert from us from the chastisement of Hell.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:75: It is truly a wretched abode and residence!'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:76: And who, when they expend, are neither prodigal nor parsimonious; but between such lies moderation;
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:78: who do not call on another god along with God, nor slay the soul which God has forbidden, except with due cause, and who do not commit fornication - for whoever does that shall meet with retribution;
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:79: doubled will be the chastisement for him on the Day of Resurrection and he will abide therein abased;
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:80: except for him who repents, and believes, and acts righteously, for such, God will replace their evil deeds with good deeds, for God is ever Forgiving, Merciful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:81: And whoever repents and acts righteously, indeed turns to God with due repentance;
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:82: and those who do not give false testimony, and, when they come across senseless talk, they pass by with dignity;
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:83: and those who, when they are reminded of the revelations of their Lord, do not fall on them deaf and blind;
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:84: and those who say, 'Our Lord! Grant us in our spouses and our offspring a joyful sight, and make us paragons for the God-fearing'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:85: Those, they will be rewarded with the sublime abode, forasmuch as they were steadfast, and they will be met therein with a greeting and [words of] peace;
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 25:87: Say, 'My Lord would not be concerned with you were it not for your supplications.

Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 25:1: Blessed is He (Allah) Who sent down to His (most beloved and most intimate) servant the Criterion (the Qur’an) that (draws the difference between right and wrong and) gives judgment in order that he may be a Warner to all the worlds;
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 25:2: He (Allah) to Whom belongs the sovereignty of the heavens and the earth, and Who has not taken (to Himself) any children, nor has He any partner in His Kingdom and He alone has created everything, and then destined (i.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 25:3: And these (polytheists) have taken besides Him other gods which cannot create anything and are themselves created and possess no power either to harm or to benefit themselves and control neither death nor life, nor (have they any authority) to raise up (after death) and assemble.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 25:4: And the disbelievers say: ‘This (Qur’an) is but a lie which this (claimant of Prophethood) has fabricated and other people have helped him in (inventing) it.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 25:5: And they say: ‘(This Qur’an comprises) fables of the ancients which this man has got written; then these (fables) are recited to him morning and evening (in order to memorize and narrate further).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 25:6: Say: ‘He (Allah) Who knows all the secrets (present) in the heavens and the earth has sent down this Qur’an.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 25:7: And they say: ‘What is the matter with this Messenger (blessings and peace be upon him)? He eats food and walks about in the marketplaces.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 25:8: Or a treasure should have been sent down to him, or (at least) he should have owned a garden so that he might eat (of its income).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 25:9: (O Esteemed Beloved!) Just see what sort of comparisons they utter for you! So they have gone astray and cannot find any path (to guidance).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 25:11: But they have denied the Last Hour (as well), and for everyone who denies the Last Hour, We have prepared the blazing Fire (of Hell).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 25:12: When that (Fire of Hell) will be visible to them (even) from a distant place, they will hear it raging and roaring.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 25:13: And when, tightly bound (together or bound to their satans,) they will be thrown into it from some narrow place, then they will cry out for (their) destruction.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 25:14: (It will be said to them:) ‘Do not call out (just) for one destruction Today but call for many more destructions.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 25:15: Say: ‘Is this (a) better (state), or the (life of) eternal Paradise promised to the Godfearing? This is their reward (of deeds) and their abode.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 25:16: (All) that they long for will be (available) for them in these (Gardens of Paradise).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 25:17: And on that Day, Allah will assemble them together with those they worshipped besides Allah.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 25:18: They will say: ‘Glory be to You.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 25:19: (O disbelievers!) They have denied what you said.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 25:20: And We did not send Messengers before you but (that) they certainly ate food and also walked about in the marketplaces (as needed).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 25:21: And those who do not hope for meeting with Us say: ‘Why were angels not sent down to us? Or if we could see our Lord (with our own eyes, we would certainly believe).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 25:22: The Day when they will see the angels, there will be no matter of joy for the evildoers anyway on that Day.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 25:23: And (then) We shall turn to the deeds they (presumably) did (in life) and shall make them scattered dust particles.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 25:24: On that Day, the lodging for the inmates of Paradise will be the best, and their resting place (too) will be excellent (where they will retire for a nap after the reckoning noon).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 25:25: And that Day, the sky will be rent asunder, changed into (the resemblance of smoke, like) a cloud, and the angels will be sent down rank upon rank.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 25:26: That Day, true sovereignty will belong to the Most Kind (Lord) and that will be very hard (i.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 25:27: And that Day, every wrongdoer will bite his hands (in fury and frustration and) will say: ‘Would that I had taken the path (of guidance by joining) the companionship of the Holy Messenger (blessings and peace be upon him)!
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 25:28: Ah! Woe to me! Would that I had not taken such a one for a friend!
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 25:29: Surely, he led me astray from the direction and guidance after it had come to me, and Satan leaves man helpless and forlorn (in the time of distress).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 25:30: And the (Holy) Messenger (blessings and peace be upon him) will submit: ‘O Lord, surely my people had utterly abandoned this Qur’an.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 25:31: And that is how We made for every Prophet (their) enemy from the evildoers (who used to oppose their Prophetic mission, and this way, a conflict between the forces of good and evil would develop and a favourable and congenial environment for peaceful change would take shape against tyranny, oppression and injustice).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 25:32: And the disbelievers say: ‘Why has the Qur’an not been (put together and) sent down to this (Prophet) in one go?’ It has been revealed gradually (in segments) so that by this We may strengthen your (most sanctified) heart, and (that is why) We have recited it gradually with pauses (in order that your heart may feel tranquil by receiving Our message again and again).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 25:33: And these (disbelievers) do not bring you any (such) instance (as an objection or inquiry), but We provide you with the truth (to reply it) and an explanation better (than that).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 25:34: (They) are such people as will be driven headlong towards Hell.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 25:35: And surely, We gave Musa (Moses) the Book, and appointed his brother Harun (Aaron) with him as his minister (for his help).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 25:36: Then We said: ‘Go, both of you, to the people who have rejected Our signs.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 25:38: as well), when they denied the Prophets, We drowned them and made them a sign of warning for (other) people.
